Chrome DevTools & Tracing

From memory consumption to image decoding, Chrome provides a complete range of tools for debugging and profiling your project's performance.

For times where you need to dig into even more detail you can use Chrome Tracing.

Articles & Guides

  • Don't Guess it, Test it!
  • Improving Web App Performance With the Chrome DevTools Timeline and Profiles
  • Trace Event Profiling Tool (about:tracing)
  • Jank Busting With Daft Punk
  • Profiling your WebGL Game with the about:tracing flag

Touch and Input

Fast responses to user interactions help make your apps feeling fluid and a joy to use.

Posts

  • Fixing :hover jank
  • The best way to avoid the dreaded 300ms click delay
  • Web-view based Android apps and touch-related issues
  • When adding touch handlers can hurt scrolling performance
  • Using Devtools new "show potential scroll bottlenecks" feature

Resources

  • Touch events community wiki

Paint

Painting is the process of filling in the pixels for your page. Everything from CSS to image decoding and resizing has consequences for paint performance.

Articles & Guides

  • Avoiding Unnecessary Paints: Animated GIF Edition
  • Visually Re-engineering CSS For Faster Paint Times
  • Avoiding Unnecessary Paints
  • Profiling long paint times with DevTools Continuous Paint Mode
  • On translate3d and Layer Creation Hacks
  • Avoiding accidental layer creation

Tools

  • Jank Vision by Bobby Schultz

Videos

  • A developer's guide to rendering performance
  • Rendering without the lumpy bits

Layout & Styles

Before the browser can paint anything it has to first apply all the styles to your elements and figure out every element's geometry on the page.

Articles

  • Preventing Layout Thrashing
  • Introducing Layout Boundaries
  • Parallaxin'
  • Why Moving Elements With Translate() Is Better Than Pos:abs Top/left
  • Scrolling performance

Tools

  • FastDOM by Wilson Page
  • Boundarizr by Paul Lewis

Videos

  • Using classList for Great Good
